title: Will you quit, go ranked only, or stay as is if draft is removed
body: Thought we could make a poll showing what could be possible side effects of what happens if normal draft is removed.

replies.body: No difference between ranked and draft.
yeah, i always try my new champions in ranked...

> [{quoted}](name=swagaflamingo,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=yuMzvdT6,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2016-11-09T01:27:18.052+0000)
>
> yeah, i always try my new champions in ranked...

honestly I would be one of those players who goes ranked only, but it would force me to only play champions I currently know and to give up on learning anything new when it comes to new picks. So yeah it would effect me in a way where I no longer experiment with new champions and just stick with what works.

They aren't removing it from NA (yet).

That said, I would probably just start using Flex Queue to practice new champions and roles.  

Solo/Duo Queue is going to be the competitive queue where ranking matters anyways.

> [{quoted}](name=EndlessSorcerer,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=yuMzvdT6,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2016-11-09T01:24:54.305+0000)
>
> They aren't removing it from NA (yet).
> 
> That said, I would probably just start using Flex Queue to practice new champions and roles.  
> 
> Solo/Duo Queue is going to be the competitive queue where ranking matters anyways.

" or stay as is  ** if **   draft is removed"
I love Blind Pick, so removing Normal Draft would barely effect me.

I haven't touched blind queue since the start of season 2 (if I remember right) when I had access to improve my ranked climbing skills in draft normals.

And I'll be damned if i ever go back to that hell hole of a troll queue.
I wouldnt play as much and a lot of people would get banned

> [{quoted}](name=Grimspeake,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=yuMzvdT6,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2016-11-09T01:28:54.457+0000)
>
> I wouldnt play as much and a lot of people would get banned

should of made

"play much less" as a option, sorry bout that.
